title: 112_s136
content: The Act titled "Ban Poisonous Additives Act of 2011" requires specific regulations regarding Bisphenol A. The "Ban Poisonous Additives Act of 2011" prohibits the use of Bisphenol A in food and beverage containers for children 3 years of age or younger, including baby bottles and cups. The "Ban Poisonous Additives Act of 2011" prohibits the use of Bisphenol A in infant formula containers, with specific effective dates for implementation. The "Ban Poisonous Additives Act of 2011" prohibits the use of Bisphenol A in infant formula containers, with specific effective dates for implementation. The container of infant formula must not contain bisphenol A, with amendments taking effect 18 months after the enactment of the Act. Additionally, the Secretary of Health and Human Services must conduct a safety assessment of products containing Bisphenol A by December 1, 2012. The Secretary of Health and Human Services must issue a revised safety assessment for food containers containing bisphenol A by December 1, 2012, to determine if there is a reasonable certainty of no harm from exposure to bisphenol A through food containers. The Secretary will evaluate the safety of containers made with bisphenol A, considering potential harm from low exposure and effects on vulnerable populations. This evaluation will also apply to alternative options. States, political subdivisions, and Indian Tribes can enforce stricter regulations than those outlined in this section. (e) Definition.--For purposes of this section, the term "container" includes the lining of a container.
